definitions.definition: A kind of scoop or ladle, chiefly used to remove the scum from brine-pans in saltworks.

definitions.example: the loot of an ancient city

definitions.definition: Plunder, booty, especially from a ransacked city.
Any prize or profit received for free, especially Christmas presents
definitions.example: 1956 "Free Loot for Children" (LIFE Magazine, 23 April 1956, p. 131)

definitions.definition: To steal, especially as part of war, riot or other group violence.
definitions.example: 1833 "Gunganarian, the leader of the Chooars, continues his system of looting and murder", The asiatic Journal and monthly register for British India and its Dependencies Black, Parbury & Allen, p. 66.
to loot a temple for valuables

definitions.definition: To examine the corpse of a fallen enemy for loot.
